meanings.definition: Die through submersion in and inhalation of water.
meanings.sent1: The swimmer was drowning in the deep pool.
meanings.sent2: He saved the child from drowning in the river.
meanings.sent3: The plant was drowning in too much water, so I moved it to a sunny spot.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was drowning in the noise of the crowded room.
meanings.sent5: The ship was slowly drowning in the stormy sea.

meanings.definition: Be overwhelmed by a large amount of something.
meanings.sent1: She was drowning in work and couldn't find time to relax.
meanings.sent2: The town was drowning in snow after the heavy blizzard.
meanings.sent3: The puppy was happily drowning in a pile of toys.
meanings.sent4: His excitement was drowning in disappointment when he lost the game.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of fresh bread was drowning in the kitchen.
